sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to <radical>allocate</radical> enough <radical>gold</radical> to buy a <kanji>gun</kanji>. Guns are weapons of the old world, so you can't just buy them with paper money. Guns have to be bought with gold coins and slabs and bricks.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself handing over an armful of gold bars to buy a single gun.
readingMnemonic: You need this <kanji>gun</kanji> so you can steal some <reading>jew</reading>els (<ja>じゅう</ja>)! Why didn't you just use your gold to buy the jewels, you ask? Because! That's not how we did things in olden days. When you want jewels you buy a gun with gold and rob a jewelry store!
readingInfo: Picture an old fashioned hold up. You're holding a gun and shoveling jewels into a burlap sack. The heist of the century!
